comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: That is Sydney Edward GREGORY, Captain of the Australian cricket team in 1912. He is wearing the "baggy green cap" which is part of the uniform of our cricket team to this day. The Australian Coat of Arms with kangaroo and emu can be distinguished on the front of the cap in this picture. Born 14 April 1970, Died 1 August 1929. Right-hand bat, Right-arm bowler. Test batting average: 24.53 runs. See portrait photo here: content-www.cricinfo.com/ci/content/player/5438.html

comment.author: 25032915@N07
comment._content: Sydney Gregory made his first debut in New South Wales in the season of 1889-1890. He was then later selected to tour England with the Australian team. He was an amazing cricketer! He is one of only three test cricketers to have batted in every position of the batting order, from one to eleven, in his test career. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Syd_Gregory

comment.author: 27043160@N04
comment._content: Anyone else find it interesting that for this photo-op he only has one of his batting gloves on?
